alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued February 26 at 10:24AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center. The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH for the following areas: NWS Las Vegas NV - CA-519 (Eastern Sierra in Inyo County) NWS Reno NV - CA-073 (Eastern Sierra in Mono County) * WHAT...The avalanche danger is expected to rise to HIGH at all elevations by 7 am Monday, February 27th. * WHERE...The eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain range between Virginia Lakes to the north to Bishop Creek to the south. * WHEN...In effect from Sun 11:00 PST to Mon 07:00 PST. * IMPACTS...New snow and strong winds will continue to stress a weak upper snowpack. Travel will be difficult. Expect widespread areas of unstable snow * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions will develop overnight and reach HIGH danger by 7 AM, Monday 2/27. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may break widely and run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
